thread.title: Butcher knife brings bloody end to love triangle in West Dallas, police say
thread.title_full: Butcher knife brings bloody end to love triangle in West Dallas, police say

author: Naheed Rajwani
title: Butcher knife brings bloody end to love triangle in West Dallas, police say
text:
Butcher knife brings bloody end to love triangle in West Dallas, police say Filed under Crime at Get Daily Dallas News Headlines Sign Up   
A Dallas man is accused of fatally stabbing his ex's new boyfriend with a butcher knife and leaving the man to die in the ex's West Dallas apartment. 
Police say Darron Taylor, 31, stormed into his ex's apartment in the 2400 block of Bickers Street on February 8 and started punching her. Darron Taylor Dallas County jail 
The woman's new boyfriend, Andrew Donnell, was inside the apartment and intervened. But Taylor grabbed a lamp from a room and started hitting Donnell in the head with it, Taylor's arrest warrant affidavit says. 
The woman tried to get away, but Taylor pushed her to the ground and tried to choke her before telling her, "You're going to die today," his affidavit states. 
The ex-girlfriend managed to escape and, while leaving the apartment to call police, saw Taylor grab a butcher knife from the kitchen and walk to where Donnell was. 
The woman was shaking and crying outside her apartment when officers arrived. Her face was bleeding and her finger was cut. 
Taylor was walking outside the apartment with head injuries and stab wounds. He was covered in blood, his affidavit said. 
Police found Andrew Donnell, 31 , lying in a pool of blood in his girlfriend's bedroom. He was taken to a hospital, where he died on Monday. 
Taylor was treated at Parkland Memorial Hospital and taken to the Dallas County jail to "prevent further family violence," his arrest affidavit states. He remains in the jail and is now charged with burglary and capital murder, jail records show. 
He later admitted to a Dallas police detective that he forced his way into his ex's apartment but he denied stabbing or assaulting his ex-girlfriend, according to his arrest affidavit. He told the detective that the confrontation actually began in the parking lot, where Donnell stabbed him before fleeing to his girlfriend's apartment. 
Taylor said he kicked in the apartment's door and got in another fight with Donnell, who stabbed him again. Taylor said he was under the impression that Donnell had ran away. View Comments
